Description: Ring-weight: raṭl. Measure of meat. Five line Kufic inscription. Made of blue-green glass. The upper half, chipped around the stamp and elsewhere.
Curator's comments: This ring-weight and and Balog's specimen, which have largely intact tops, show that a counterstamp was not always, if ever, used with this type. A second die for a raṭl of meat, that of OA+ 4357, is found on another piece (Balog 1976, 65) accompanied by the same counterstamp dated 114 as appears on OA+ 4379. This shows that the stamp of 1895,0312.2 and 1895,1220.4 was in use before the one associated with the stamp of 114, a year nearly at the end of ʿUbaydāllāh's exceptionally long period of office. See 1895,1220.4. Bibliography: Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (46)
Condition: The upper half, chipped around the stamp and elsewhere.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
